member.name: M:Thorlabs.TL4000.TL4000.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: This function creates an IVI instrument driver session, typically using the C session instrument handle.
member.param: The instrument handle that is used to create an IVI instrument driver session.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.TL4000.TL4000.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
This function initializes the instrument driver session and performs the following initialization actions:
(1) Opens a session to the Default Resource Manager resource and a session to the specified device using the Resource Name specified. (2) Performs an identification query on the instrument. (3) Resets the instrument to a known state. (4) Sends initialization commands to the instrument. (5) Returns an instrument handle which is used to distinguish between different sessions of this instrument driver.
Note: Each time this function is invoked a unique session is opened.
member.param:
This parameter specifies whether an identification query is performed during the initialization process.
VI_OFF (0): Skip query. VI_ON (1): Do query (default).

This parameter specifies whether the instrument is reset during the initialization process.
VI_OFF (0) - no reset VI_ON (1) - instrument is reset (default)

For Status Codes see function <Error Message>.

member.param:
Specifies the register to be used for operation. This parameter can be any of the following constants:
TL4000_REG_SRE (1): Service Request Enable TL4000_REG_ESE (3): Standard Event Enable TL4000_REG_OPER_ENAB (6): Operation Event Enable Register TL4000_REG_OPER_PTR (7): Operation Positive Transition TL4000_REG_OPER_NTR (8): Operation Negative Transition TL4000_REG_QUES_ENAB (11): Questionable Event Enable Reg. TL4000_REG_QUES_PTR (12): Questionable Positive Transition TL4000_REG_QUES_NTR (13): Questionable Negative Transition TL4000_REG_MEAS_ENAB (16): Measurement Event Enable Register TL4000_REG_MEAS_PTR (17): Measurement Positive Transition TL4000_REG_MEAS_NTR (18): Measurement Negative Transition TL4000_REG_AUX_ENAB (21): Auxiliary Event Enable Register TL4000_REG_AUX_PTR (22): Auxiliary Positive Transition TL4000_REG_AUX_NTR (23): Auxiliary Negative Transition
This parameter specifies the register value.
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.

TL4000_REG_QUES_PTR (12): Questionable Positive Transition TL4000_REG_QUES_NTR (13): Questionable Negative Transition TL4000_REG_MEAS_COND (14): Measurement Condition Register TL4000_REG_MEAS_EVENT (15): Measurement Event Register TL4000_REG_MEAS_ENAB (16): Measurement Event Enable Register TL4000_REG_MEAS_PTR (17): Measurement Positive Transition TL4000_REG_MEAS_NTR (18): Measurement Negative Transition TL4000_REG_AUX_COND (19): Auxiliary Condition Register TL4000_REG_AUX_EVENT (20): Auxiliary Event Register TL4000_REG_AUX_ENAB (21): Auxiliary Event Enable Register TL4000_REG_AUX_PTR (22): Auxiliary Positive Transition TL4000_REG_AUX_NTR (23): Auxiliary Negative Transition

member.summary:

Note: This function is valid for: TED4000, ITC4000
member.param:
This parameter returns the PID Auto-Tune state.
Possible return values are: TL4000_AUTOPID_NEVER (0) : Never run for this configuration TL4000_AUTOPID_RUNNING (1) : Auto-PID is currently running TL4000_AUTOPID_CANCELED (2) : Canceled by user TL4000_AUTOPID_FAILED (3) : Auto-PID procedure failed TL4000_AUTOPID_SUCCESS (4) : Auto-PID finished successfully
Note: You may pass VI_NULL if you don't need this value.

This parameter returns the PID Auto-Tune phase. This value is useful in the TL4000_AUTOPID_RUNNING (1) state only.
Note: You may pass VI_NULL if you don't need this value.

This parameter returns the PID Auto-Tune loop count. This value is useful in the TL4000_AUTOPID_RUNNING (1) state only.
Note: You may pass VI_NULL if you don't need this value.

member.name: M:Thorlabs.TL4000.TL4000.configure(System.Int16)
member.summary:
This function is used to configure a measurement. I.e. set the parameter to be measured.
Note: This function is valid for: TED4000, LDC4000, ITC4000, CLD1000
member.param:
This parameter specifies the parameter to be measured.
Values: TL4000_MEAS_TEC_TEMP (0) - TEC temperature TL4000_MEAS_TEC_CURR (1) - TEC current TL4000_MEAS_TEC_VOLT (2) - TEC voltage TL4000_MEAS_TEC_POW (3) - TEC electrical power TL4000_MEAS_TEC_SENS (4) - TEC sensor TL4000_MEAS_LD_CURR (10) - Laser Diode current TL4000_MEAS_LD_VOLT (11) - Laser Diode voltage TL4000_MEAS_LD_POW (12) - Laser Diode electrical power TL4000_MEAS_PD_CURR (13) - Photodiode current TL4000_MEAS_OPT_POW_PD (14) - optical power via photodiode TL4000_MEAS_TP_VOLT (15) - Thermopile/Power Meter voltage TL4000_MEAS_OPT_POW_TP (16) - optical power via thermopile
member.returns: This is the error code returned by the function call. For error codes and descriptions see <Error Message>.
